CatDescriptText: Mr. Jake Williams, tipstaff, 741 Bryn Mawr Rd. and James R. Williams, construction worker, 3364 Milwaukee St., were part of the Pittsburghers Speak Up column, published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, September 12, 1959, pg. A13 with question: "Do you think that the President of the United States should intervene in the steel strike, or should he wait, and then invoke the 80-day 'cooling off' period as prescribed in the Taft-Hartley Act?" Jake Williams' answer reads: "I think if the President feels that he can do any good by intervening, he should. There are so many people affected by the steel strike."  James R. Williams' answer reads: I don't think the President should intervene.  I think workers should have the final vote in the settlement."
TitMainTitle: Group portrait of Jake Williams and James R. Williams, standing on sidewalk with William's BAR B Q
